tournament.name: Grand Prix Copenhagen 2017 - Last Chance Trial

decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly playing out a swarm of artifact creatures and boosting them with equipment like Cranial Plating. The goal is to deal significant damage quickly, overwhelming the opponent with a combination of flyers and powerful artifact synergy. The key strength lies in the ability to consistently play multiple artifacts in a turn, maximizing the value of cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager. The use of Inkmoth Nexus also provides an alternate win condition by turning into a flying Infect creature.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out a wide array of artifact creatures and utilizing mana acceleration to power out threats like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager. Signal Pest and Steel Overseer help to pump up the team, while the artifact lands and Mox Opal provide additional mana sources. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and efficient use of synergy between artifacts and creature abilities. The key strategy is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain board presence to secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, Lightning Bolt, and Boros Charm, this deck aims to keep up constant pressure on the opponent and finish the game before the opponent can set up their own strategy. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Eidolon of the Great Revel to hinder the opponent's ability to play spells, further increasing the chances of victory through swift and decisive aggression.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing you to play out your entire deck using Collected Company and Chord of Calling to find key creatures like Eternal Witness, Renegade Rallier, and Duskwatch Recruiter. The deck also utilizes a toolbox strategy, utilizing cards like Selfless Spirit, Scavenging Ooze, and Rhonas the Indomitable to support and protect your combo. The mana base includes various fetch lands and creature lands to help fix your mana and provide additional utility.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a combo involving Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing for various powerful plays such as casting Walking Ballista for a lethal amount of damage. The deck includes a toolbox of creatures to search for with Chord of Calling and Collected Company, providing flexibility in finding the right creature for the situation. The goal is to efficiently find and execute the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly bring your own life total down in order to pump up Death's Shadow and create a powerful threat on the board. This aggressive strategy is supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate, and card advantage engines like Thought Scour and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to apply pressure early and finish the game quickly with the help of powerful creatures like Gurmag Angler and Death's Shadow, while protecting them with countermagic like Stubborn Denial.

This deck revolves around using life loss as a resource to power up Death's Shadow, a powerful threat that grows larger the lower your life total gets. The deck also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, and card advantage engines like Mishra's Bauble. The goal is to quickly lower your own life total, deploy a big Death's Shadow, and disrupt your opponent's game plan while attacking with your powerful creatures for a fast win.

The main idea of the deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting, allowing you to cast dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug to bring back creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba from the graveyard. By recurring these creatures and triggering effects like Prized Amalgam, you can overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and potentially win the game in just a few turns. The key to success lies in efficiently dredging and maintaining a balance between card advantage and graveyard manipulation.

This deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board of Elves utilizing its mana acceleration abilities to generate an overwhelming advantage over the opponent. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, the player can quickly find key combo pieces like Shaman of the Pack and Ezuri, Renegade Leader to deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn. The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond effectively.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with elf creatures and generating mana quickly through ramp and combo synergy. By casting Lead the Stampede and Collected Company, the player can refill their hand and put more elves into play. The key win condition is to utilize the abilities of Shaman of the Pack and Ezuri, Renegade Leader to deal damage directly to the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient elf tribal combo strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures. The key strategy revolves around using Gifts Ungiven to tutor for specific cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck can generate card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Nahiri, the Harbinger. The deck is versatile and can adapt to different situations based on the opponent's threats.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage quickly. It also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt to finish off the opponent. The deck seeks to win the game as fast as possible by dealing consistent damage and preventing the opponent from stabilizing. The landbase consists of fetch lands to ensure consistent mana fixing and enabling the deck to play its spells on curve. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient damage output.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the necessary cards to generate a high storm count and win the game in a single turn. The key cards are Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, reducing the cost of spells and providing extra mana. Using rituals and cantrips, the deck aims to cast multiple spells in one turn, building up to a lethal Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens. Gifts Ungiven helps search for key combo pieces, while the deck utilizes Past in Flames to play spells from the graveyard for a final explosive finish.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful threats such as Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon ahead of schedule. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Path to Exile to deal with opposing threats, as well as cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies. The end game usually involves casting massive Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to quickly close out the game.

The main focus of the UW Control deck is to control the game through counter spells, removal, and card draw while slowly building up to a win condition. The deck uses cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Supreme Verdict to control the board and maintain card advantage with Ancestral Vision and Serum Visions. In addition, the deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to close out the game. Spreading Seas also helps disrupt opponent's mana base while providing card draw. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantages.

This Naya Zoo deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary, Tarmogoyf, and Loxodon Smiter, supported by mana ramp from cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile to keep the opponent's board in check. By efficiently deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Wild Nacatl, Tarmogoyf, and Knight of the Reliquary to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats. The deck utilizes Collected Company to create surprise plays and generate additional creatures. The mana base is built to support casting the diverse range of spells efficiently. Overall, the main strategy is to establish board presence early and apply pressure to the opponent while maintaining a solid defense with creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Loxodon Smiter.
